chapterTitle: Some Lessons From Capital Market History

columns.text: In this problem, we will solve for the arithmetic and geometric averages using the dividends from each year.

The arithmetic average can be solved by simply dividing the sum of all rates of return by the number of years. On the other hand, the geometric average uses the product of these values to get the average. These are the pertinent formulas that we will use:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Arithmetic average}&=\dfrac{\text{Sum of values}}{\text{number of years}}\\[15 pt]
\text{Geometric average}&=[(1+x_1)\times(1+x_2)\times(1+x_n)]^\frac{1}{n}-1
\end{aligned}$$

Where x is the value for the rate of return and n is the number of years.

Substituting the values, we will get: 

**1st year**:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Rate of return}&=\dfrac{\$0.85+(\$70.20-\$63.40)}{\$63.40}\\[15 pt]
&=0.121
\end{aligned}$$

The rate of return for the first year is $0.121$ or $12.1\%$

**2nd year**:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Rate of return}&=\dfrac{\$0.95+(\$79.18-\$70.20)}{\$70.20}\\[15 pt]
&=0.141
\end{aligned}$$

The rate of return for the first year is $0.141$ or $14.1\%$

**3rd year**:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Rate of return}&=\dfrac{\$1.03+(\$75.32-\$79.18)}{\$79.18}\\[15 pt]
&=-0.0357
\end{aligned}$$

The rate of return for the first year is $-0.0357$ or $-3.57\%$

**4th year**:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Rate of return}&=\dfrac{\$1.11+(\$84.18-\$75.32)}{\$75.32}\\[15 pt]
&=0.132
\end{aligned}$$

The rate of return for the first year is $0.132$ or $13.2\%$

**5th year**:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Rate of return}&=\dfrac{\$1.20+(\$98.62-\$84.18)}{\$84.18}\\[15 pt]
&=0.186
\end{aligned}$$

The rate of return for the first year is $0.186$ or $18.6\%$
Now that we have the rates of return, we can now solve for the different averages using the formula in **Step 2**.

For the **arithmetic average**:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Arithmetic average}&=\dfrac{0.121+0.141-0.0357+0.132+0.186}{5}\\[15 pt]
&=0.1089
\end{aligned}$$

The arithmetic average is $0.1089$ or $10.89\%$

For the **geometric average**:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Geometric average}&=[(1+0.121)\times(1+0.141)\times(1-0.0357)\\
&\times(1+0.132)\times(1+0.186)]^\frac{1}{5}-1\\[15 pt]

&=1.1061-1\\[15 pt]
&=0.1061
\end{aligned}$$

The geometric average is $0.1061$ or $10.61\%$
